title: Welcome to My Blog!
description: This is my New blog for code relating to Political and Social Networks

title: Homework_2_Network
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
library(network)

library(igraph)





data(flo, package="network")

matrix <- as.matrix(flo) 

florentine<- graph.adjacency(flo, mode="directed", weighted=NULL)


plot(florentine)






vcount(florentine)


[1] 16

ecount(florentine)


[1] 40

title: Initial Network Analysis Florentine Family
description: Homework 2: Brief Analysis of the Florentine Family Set
contents:
data(flo, package="network")

matrix <- as.matrix(flo) 

florentine<- graph.adjacency(flo, mode="directed", weighted=NULL)

plot(florentine)






vcount(florentine)


[1] 16

ecount(florentine)


[1] 40



is_bipartite(florentine)


[1] FALSE

is_directed(florentine)


[1] TRUE

is_weighted(florentine)


[1] FALSE



vertex_attr_names(florentine)


[1] "name"

edge_attr_names(florentine)


character(0)



igraph::dyad.census(florentine)


$mut
[1] 20

$asym
[1] 0

$null
[1] 100



igraph::triad_census(florentine)


 [1] 324   0 195   0   0   0   0   0   0   0  38   0   0   0   0   3



transitivity(florentine, type="global")


[1] 0.1914894



transitivity(florentine, type="average")


[1] 0.2181818



V(florentine)[c("Peruzzi","Lamberteschi", "Ginori")]


+ 3/16 vertices, named, from 398dd1d:
[1] Peruzzi      Lamberteschi Ginori      



transitivity(florentine, type="local", vids=V(florentine)[c("Peruzzi","Lamberteschi", "Ginori")]) 


[1] 0.6666667       NaN       NaN



distances(florentine,"Peruzzi", "Lamberteschi")


        Lamberteschi
Peruzzi            3



distances(florentine,"Peruzzi", "Ginori")


        Ginori
Peruzzi      4



distances(florentine,"Lamberteschi","Ginori")


             Ginori
Lamberteschi      3
